page.title: 08CHANGES IN LANGHAM
page.content: During the last 80 years there have been many changes in the village.Years ago people tended to stay in the village,and it was a great treat to occasionally go into the town by horse and cart.Nowadays it is a commuter village with people travelling large distances to work e.g.London on a daily basis.The houses did not have piped water,and it had to be fetched from the two village pumps.The waste water was thrown into the brook then in the summer the brook was dammed to form a swimming pool.There were no flush toilets,and people had a hut in the garden with an earth closet. Most people kept a pig,which was killed at Christmas for ham and bacon.Others also had cows or sheep and these were all grazed together on "The Pastures".
